solution.text:
Here, the class size varies. Let us apply the assumed mean method.
Then,
we obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Study hours & \text{no.of students(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{di=xi-3.5} & \text{fidi} \\\hline1-2 & _{i}_ & 1.5 & -2 & _{{i*(-2)}}_ \\2-3 & _{j}_ & 2.5 & -1 & _{{j*(-1)}}_ \\3-4 & _{k}_ & 3.5 & 0 & _{{k*0}}_ \\4-5 & _{l}_ & 4.5 & 1 & _{{l*1}}_ \\5-6 & _{m}_ & 5.5 & 2 & _{{m*2}}_ \\\hline \ Total & _{{i+j+k+l+m}}_ & & & _{{(i*(-2))+(j*(-1))+(k*0)+(l*1)+(m*2)}}_ \\\hline \end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sumfidi
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = 3.5 + \(\Sigma fidi\over \Sigma fi\) = 3.5 +\(_{{(i*(-2))+(j*(-1))+(k*0)+(l*1)+(m*2)}}_\over _{{i+j+k+l+m}}_\) = _{{trunc(Decimal(3.5)+(((i*(-2))+(j*(-1))+(k*0)+(l*1)+(m*2))/(Decimal(i)+j+k+l+m)),5)}}_

content.text:
A survey was conducted to know how much hours students study at home.Following data was collected in the survey.Find the mean hours students study at home using Assumed mean methode.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Study hours & \text{1-2} & \text{2-3} & \text{3-4} & \text{4-5} & \text{5-6} \\\hline \ No. of students & _{i}_ & _{j}_ & _{k}_ & _{l}_ & _{m}_ \\ \hline\end{array}
